verbs.description: backpedal (third-person singular simple present backpedals, present participle (US) backpedaling or (UK) backpedalling, simple past and past participle (US) backpedaled or (UK) backpedalled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To pedal backwards on a bicycle.

examples: The player had to backpedal before catching the ball.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, idiomatic) To distance oneself from an earlier claim or statement; back off from an idea.
examples: Though initially adopting a hard-line stance, the politician soon started to backpedal.
